00034 /** @file decl.h
00035     @brief Declarations related to type declarations; the parser basically
00036     creates instances of these classes, which are then turned into actual
00037     Types.
00038 
00039     Three classes work together to represent declarations.  As an example,
00040     consider a declaration like:
00041 
00042     static uniform int foo, bar[10];
00043 
00044     An instance of the Declaration class represents this entire declaration
00045     of two variables, 'foo' and 'bar'.  It holds a single instance of the
00046     DeclSpecs class represents the common specifiers for all of the
00047     variables--here, that the declaration has the 'static' and 'uniform'
00048     qualifiers, and that it's basic type is 'int'.  Then for each variable
00049     declaration, the Declaraiton class holds an instance of a Declarator,
00050     which in turn records the per-variable information like the symbol
00051     name, array size (if any), initializer expression, etc.
00052 */
00053 
00054 #ifndef ISPC_DECL_H
00055 #define ISPC_DECL_H
00056 
00057 #include "ispc.h"
00058 
00059 enum StorageClass {
00060     SC_NONE,
00061     SC_EXTERN,
00062     SC_EXPORT,
00063     SC_STATIC,
00064     SC_TYPEDEF,
00065     SC_EXTERN_C
00066 };
00067 
00068 
00069 /* Multiple qualifiers can be provided with types in declarations;
00070    therefore, they are set up so that they can be ANDed together into an
00071    int. */
00072 #define TYPEQUAL_NONE           0
00073 #define TYPEQUAL_CONST      (1<<0)
00074 #define TYPEQUAL_UNIFORM    (1<<1)
00075 #define TYPEQUAL_VARYING    (1<<2)
00076 #define TYPEQUAL_TASK       (1<<3)
00077 #define TYPEQUAL_REFERENCE  (1<<4)
00078 #define TYPEQUAL_UNSIGNED   (1<<5)
00079 #define TYPEQUAL_INLINE     (1<<6)
00080 
00081 /** @brief Representation of the declaration specifiers in a declaration.
00082 
00083     In other words, this represents all of the stuff that applies to all of
00084     the (possibly multiple) variables in a declaration.
00085  */
00086 class DeclSpecs {
00087 public:
00088     DeclSpecs(const Type *t = NULL, StorageClass sc = SC_NONE, int tq = TYPEQUAL_NONE);
00089 
00090     void Print() const;
00091 
00092     StorageClass storageClass;
00093 
00094     /** Zero or more of the TYPEQUAL_* values, ANDed together. */
00095     int typeQualifier;
00096 
00097     /** The basic type provided in the declaration; this should be an
00098         AtomicType, a StructType, or a VectorType; other types (like
00099         ArrayTypes) will end up being created if a particular declaration
00100         has an array size, etc.
00101     */
00102     const Type *baseType;
00103 
00104     /** If this is a declaration with a vector type, this gives the vector
00105         width.  For non-vector types, this is zero.
00106      */
00107     int vectorSize;
00108 
00109     /** If this is a declaration with an "soa<n>" qualifier, this gives the
00110         SOA width specified.  Otherwise this is zero.
00111      */
00112     int soaWidth;
00113 };
00114 
00115 
00116 /** @brief Representation of the declaration of a single variable.  
00117 
00118     In conjunction with an instance of the DeclSpecs, this gives us
00119     everything we need for a full variable declaration.
00120  */
00121 class Declarator {
00122 public:
00123     Declarator(Symbol *s, SourcePos p);
00124 
00125     /** As the parser peels off array dimension declarations after the
00126         symbol name, it calls this method to provide them to the
00127         Declarator.
00128      */
00129     void AddArrayDimension(int size);
00130 
00131     /** Once a DeclSpecs instance is available, this method completes the
00132         initialization of the Symbol, setting its Type accordingly.
00133      */
00134     void InitFromDeclSpecs(DeclSpecs *ds);
00135 
00136     /** Get the actual type of the combination of Declarator and the given
00137         DeclSpecs */
00138     const Type *GetType(DeclSpecs *ds) const;
00139 
00140     void Print() const;
00141 
00142     const SourcePos pos;
00143     Symbol *sym;
00144     /** If this declarator includes an array specification, the sizes of
00145         the array dimensions are represented here.
00146      */
00147     std::vector<int> arraySize;
00148     /** Initialization expression for the variable.  May be NULL. */
00149     Expr *initExpr;
00150     bool isFunction;
00151     std::vector<Declaration *> *functionArgs;
00152 };
00153 
00154 
00155 /** @brief Representation of a full declaration of one or more variables,
00156     including the shared DeclSpecs as well as the per-variable Declarators.
00157  */
00158 class Declaration {
00159 public:
00160     Declaration(DeclSpecs *ds, std::vector<Declarator *> *dlist = NULL) {
00161         declSpecs = ds;
00162         if (dlist != NULL)
00163             declarators = *dlist;
00164         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < declarators.size(); ++i)
00165             if (declarators[i] != NULL)
00166                 declarators[i]->InitFromDeclSpecs(declSpecs);
00167     }
00168     Declaration(DeclSpecs *ds, Declarator *d) {
00169         declSpecs = ds;
00170         if (d) {
00171             d->InitFromDeclSpecs(ds);
00172             declarators.push_back(d);
00173         }
00174     }
00175 
00176     /** Adds the symbols for the variables in the declaration to the symbol
00177         table. */
00178     void AddSymbols(SymbolTable *st) const;
00179     void Print() const;
00180 
00181     DeclSpecs *declSpecs;
00182     std::vector<Declarator *> declarators;
00183 };
00184 
00185 
00186 /** The parser creates instances of StructDeclaration for the members of
00187     structs as it's parsing their declarations. */
00188 struct StructDeclaration {
00189     StructDeclaration(const Type *t, std::vector<Declarator *> *d)
00190         : type(t), declarators(d) { }
00191 
00192     const Type *type;
00193     std::vector<Declarator *> *declarators;
00194 };
00195 
00196 
00197 /** Given a set of StructDeclaration instances, this returns the types of
00198     the elements of the corresponding struct and their names. */
00199 extern void GetStructTypesNamesPositions(const std::vector<StructDeclaration *> &sd,
00200                                          std::vector<const Type *> *elementTypes,
00201                                          std::vector<std::string> *elementNames,
00202                                          std::vector<SourcePos> *elementPositions);

00204 #endif // ISPC_DECL_H
